Comment: Trump tends to mention running for a third term when things are going badly and he needs a distraction to change the narrative.  Whatever you do, don‚Äôt fall for it.  Section 1 of the 22nd Amendment states that ‚ÄúNo person shall be elected to the office of the President more than twice.  Additionally, no person who has held the office of President for more than two years of a term to which some other person was elected President shall be elected to the office of the President more than once.‚Äù  Amendments require a two-thirds majority vote in BOTH the House of Representatives and the Senate or by a constitutional convention called for by two-thirds of the State legislatures.  None of the previous 27 amendments to the Constitution have been proposed by constitutional convention.  It would require an overwhelming convergence of circumstances that, quite honestly, could never and will never happen.
Author: Tcanderson

Comment: Sadly, this seems *totally possible* going by the actual *text of the amendment*, which indicates no person can "be elected" as President more than twice.  Once again:  no person **can be elected to the office of President more than twice**.  But as the article points out, it would seem to be no violation at all for Trump to be someone's VP (Vance) - and then the person elected President (who wasn't Trump) would simply... resign.  Leaving VP Trump to become President.  Without having actually been elected President (he was elected as VP), thus staying **entirely within the bounds of 22A**.  Now... how likely is it that someone elected Pres would willingly step aside?  I can't speak to that, but Vance is a weak-willed couch fucker, so... seems possible.  He sure wouldn't want to piss off MAGA.
